item.title: Reading Logs as Compasses
item.description:
A reading log is not a list, it is a map of where your attention goes.

Write the single line you would want to remember. That line is the compass point.

After a month, patterns appear. Follow the pattern.

item.title: The Daily Compass
item.description:
Clarity is a feature. The first line should survive a scan and still be true.

If a tool needs a tour, it is too large. Good tools disappear into the work.

Write the note, then walk away. If it still matters tomorrow, it deserves the next pass.
